results.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 115) to amend title 18, United States Code, to provide additional aggravating factors for the imposition of the death penalty based on the status of the victim.
results.short_title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 115) to amend title 18, United States Code, to provide additional aggravating factors for the imposition of the death penalty based on the status of the victim.
results.latest_major_action: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
results.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 115) to amend title 18, United States Code, to provide additional aggravating factors for the imposition of the death penalty based on the status of the victim.
results.summary_short: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 115) to amend title 18, United States Code, to provide additional aggravating factors for the imposition of the death penalty based on the status of the victim.

actions.description: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 233 - 184 (Roll no. 260). (text: CR H4237)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 230 - 189 (Roll no. 259). (consideration: CR H4244-4245)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 323.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H4237-4245)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 49.

The resolution provides that an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-17 shall be considered as adopted and the bill, as amended, shall be considered as read.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-126, by Mr. Buck.
